content.description: Start standing at the center of the face and move left on interesting slopers then up the arête and short overhanging face.  A little coarse but the rock quality is good. The climb up the arête was pre-existing, I just added a few moves to fill it out.
content.protection: Bouldering pad, spotters and common sense.
content.location:
Balsam - Located 30 feet or so to the west of the ShooFly/No Girth boulder.

Please:

Treat the land with respect.

Take all of your personal stuff and trash with you when you leave.

Keep a low profile and have fun.

content.description: Sit start on the flat jug to the left and the foot right under it. Then a couple of traverse-y type moves and matches to the right until you can do the crucial heel-hook for a dyno to a sloper. Pretty easy top out after that.
content.protection: One crash pad and a spotter should do the trick.
content.location: Once you reach the Shaver Lake bouldering area with Sloth, Royale w/ Cheese...etc, head up the hill and walk over some fallen, decaying trees. Go through the small manzanita grove and you'll see a boulder to your left. Go past that one and you'll see another large boulder with a cave under the left side. Go around the back of this one and you'll find the problem.

content.description: Start low on the good incut hold then toehook and finesse your way to the enormous crux move to a good finger bucket on the lip, then top out.  The reach at the end is pretty big and at this time, the climb has yet to see a complete ascent.  Not sure on the rating yet. Quality.
content.location:
This route is in the "Whiskeytown" area at Balsam, east of the 'ShooFly/NoGirth boulder about 200 yards on the ridgeline.  The large boulder has a couple very esthetic lines on it including 'AncientAge', another route that may go right from the low start hold, and a complete traverse from right to left, ending on Ancient.  The east side of the boulder has a climb in the V2-V3 range titled 'Sour Mash'.  The smaller boulder to the west of the big one has the climb '100 Poof'.

Please:

Treat the land with respect.

Take all of your personal stuff and trash with you when you leave.

Keep a low profile and have fun.

content.description: Sit start on two small ledges and/or a pinch out left.  Climb up and slightly left past a jug, some nice crimpers and a fun pinch on the small arête to top out.
content.protection: Bouldering pad, spotters and common sense.
content.location:
Balsam - About 200 yards eest of the 'ShooFly/No Girth' Boulder on the ridge.

Please:

Treat the land with respect.

Take all of your personal stuff and trash with you when you leave.

Keep a low profile and have fun.
